analyzed: sngon gyi sems sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can ni las yin pa'i phyir des 'du byed nye bar len par byed do //

original: dngos gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos gyi rgyu ni ma yin te /

original: 'on te yang /
analyzed: 'on te yang /

analyzed: 'gro dang rtogs pa'i byed brten ni //

analyzed: de dag ma mthong ba las yin //

analyzed: ma mthong 'jig phyir 'gro ba med //
translated: There is no going to a place not seen,

analyzed: de 'du byed pa'i sems pa min //
translated: nor is it the intention to form.

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: Here,

analyzed: 'gro ba ste 'jug pa dang rtog pa de shes pa'i byed pa ni lag pa la sogs pa dang / mig la sogs pa rim pa bzhin du brten pa yin no //
translated: the activity of the cognition of going, i.e., of entering and imagining, is based on the hands, etc., and the eyes, etc., respectively.

original: byed pa de dag ma mthong ba'i las las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa de dag ma mthong ba'i las las 'byung ba ste /
translated: That activity is not seen to arise from karma.

original: dbang bskur ba yang ma mthong ba 'jig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba yang ma mthong ba 'jig pa'i phyir /
translated: And since the consecration is not seen to perish,

original: skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: there is no going to another birth.

original: de bas na de'i 'du byed de /
analyzed: de bas na de'i 'du byed de /
translated: Therefore, its formation,

analyzed: las kyi 'du byed dge ba bcu dang mi dge ba rnam pa bcu kho na sems pa'i ngo bo nyid de med par 'gyur ro //
translated: the ten virtuous and nonvirtuous karmic formations, would not exist, since they are by nature intention.

analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge pa'i las de dag kyang dbang bskur bas 'jig pa'i phyir yang srid par 'jug pa ma yin no zhe na /

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: 'di'i don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i don ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of that is not established.

original: byed pa skyed phyir yod med kyi //
analyzed: byed pa skyed phyir yod med kyi //
translated: Because it generates activity, it is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: rjes su 'jug pas bla'i nus pa //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pas bla'i nus pa //
translated: The power of the mind that follows,

original: mthong ba yin gyi gzhan gyis min //
analyzed: mthong ba yin gyi gzhan gyis min //
translated: not of any other, is the cause of seeing.

original: de yod de dag ci ste 'gro //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos /
analyzed: de yod de dag ci ste 'gro // zhes bya ba la / rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i blos /

analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i byed pa rnams skyed par nus pa nges pa yin gyi /
translated: The mind that follows and turns back is the cause of the production of the eye, etc.

original: blo dang bral ba'i las sngon du byas pa'i nus pa gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo dang bral ba'i las sngon du byas pa'i nus pa gzhan ni ma yin no //

original: 'chi ba'i dus kyi blo de ni dbang bskur ba la yang yod do //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kyi blo de ni dbang bskur ba la yang yod do //
translated: The mind at the time of death is also the consecration of the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa de dag las kyi rjes su 'gro bar ci ste mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de dag las kyi rjes su 'gro bar ci ste mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why do the eye, etc. not follow the action?

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa sems pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa sems pas byin gyis brlabs nas /
translated: Because the eye, etc. are consecrated by the mind,

original: rigs mthun pa can gyi byed par nams mthong ba yid la dbang bskur ba la yang /
analyzed: rigs mthun pa can gyi byed par nams mthong ba yid la dbang bskur ba la yang /
translated: and because the mind that is consecrated by the mind is seen to be the cause of the eye, etc.

original: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang ldan pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan chad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang sred pa dang ldan pa'i blo yod pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan chad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mind that is accompanied by ignorance and craving is the cause of the eye, etc.

original: 'on te dbang gis nye bar bcom pa'i mig la sogs pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan du 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang gis nye bar bcom pa'i mig la sogs pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir skye ba gzhan du 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is the mind of the eye, etc. that is destroyed by the power of the faculties, then it does not arise in another life.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: If that is so,

original: de rnams nus med dbang la sogs //
analyzed: de rnams nus med dbang la sogs //
translated: then those faculties would be powerless.🔽Immediately after that, the mind would not be able to hold,

analyzed: de ma thag tu de dag gi /'dzin bskul 'khrul dang 'gog pa dang // sems pa'i dbang gis 'gyur ma yin // zhes bya ba la gal te blo la sogs pa dbang @393a * //
translated: stimulate, err, or cease, due to the power of intention.

original: gis bcom pa yin na /
analyzed: gis bcom pa yin na /
translated: If the mind, etc. is destroyed by the power of the faculties,

original: skye par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skye par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: it would not be able to arise.

original: de'i tshe dbang bskur ba de'i de ma thag pa nyid du blo bcom pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang bskur ba de'i de ma thag pa nyid du blo bcom pa'i phyir /
translated: At that time, immediately after the bestowal of the faculties, the mind would be destroyed.

original: yul la rang gi 'dod pas 'jug pa'i sems 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la nges par 'jug pas bskul ba dang 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: yul la rang gi 'dod pas 'jug pa'i sems 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la nges par 'jug pas bskul ba dang 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the mind that engages its object as it wishes, the stimulation of the mind to definitely engage the desired object, and error🔽would not exist.

original: 'khrul par gyur pa nyid dang / 'gog pa ste 'jig ba de dag med pa 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'khrul par gyur pa nyid dang / 'gog pa ste 'jig ba de dag med pa 'gyur te //
translated: Cessation, i.e., destruction, would not exist.

original: de dag sems dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / sems la sogs pa de rnams dbang bskur ba'i mthus gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag sems dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / sems la sogs pa de rnams dbang bskur ba'i mthus gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because they are related to mind, and because those minds, etc., become clear through the power of consecration.

original: de ltar gyur na ni dbang gis de ma thag tu chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni dbang gis de ma thag tu chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the consecration would be cut off immediately after it.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa rnams shi pa'i rjes la nus pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa rnams shi pa'i rjes la nus pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the eyes, etc., become powerless after death,

analyzed: de dag yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because they depend on a special transformation,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

analyzed: gal te dbang gis de ma thag par dbang gi mthus chad par mi 'gyur na ni yongs su gyur pa las phyis nus pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med do ;
translated: If the consecration were not cut off immediately after it through the power of consecration, then there would be no evidence for the claim that it becomes powerless later on through transformation.

original: ;'on te de tshe blo med phyir //
analyzed: ;'on te de tshe blo med phyir //
translated: If it is argued that it does not become powerless because there is no mind at that time,

original: mi 'gyur dri ma rnams kyi blo //
analyzed: mi 'gyur dri ma rnams kyi blo //
translated: then the mind of the defilements

original: mtshams sbyor de rnams nus med na //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor de rnams nus med na //
translated: would be powerless to connect,

original: gson pa nyid kyi'ang nus med 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gson pa nyid kyi'ang nus med 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: and it would be powerless even in life.

analyzed: de'i tshe ste 'chi ba'i dus na blo nyid med pa'i phyir byed pa rnams yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, i.e., at the time of death, the mind itself does not exist, therefore the actions do not exist.

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe mtshams sbyor ba dang / blo dang bral bar byed pa dang sems pa med pas slar skye ba med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe mtshams sbyor ba dang / blo dang bral bar byed pa dang sems pa med pas slar skye ba med par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In this way, at that time, since there is no linking up, no mind, and no intention, would there not be no rebirth?

original: blo de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams kyis mtshams sbyor ba ma yin na ma /
analyzed: blo de 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma rnams kyis mtshams sbyor ba ma yin na ma /
translated: If that mind is not linked up by the defilements of passion, etc.,

original: dbang bskur ba la dri ma yod pa'i blo bcom pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba la dri ma yod pa'i blo bcom pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then the mind that is destroyed by the defilements of the consecration is not.

original: 'on te dbang bskur bas 'dod chags la sogs pa bcom pa'i phyir blo skyed par mi nus so zhe na ma yin te de'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams nus pa med na ni /
analyzed: 'on te dbang bskur bas 'dod chags la sogs pa bcom pa'i phyir blo skyed par mi nus so zhe na ma yin te de'i tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa de rnams nus pa med na ni /
translated: But if you say that the consecration cannot generate the mind because it destroys passion, etc., that is not so, because at that time, if those passions, etc., are powerless,

analyzed: gson pa nyid kyi dri ma rnams kyang nus pa med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir dbang bskur ba'i rjes thogs kho na ra grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the defilements of life itself are powerless. Therefore, immediately after the consecration, there is liberation.

original: 'on te dbang bskur bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma med kyi /
analyzed: 'on te dbang bskur bas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i dri ma med kyi /

analyzed: 'on kyang yongs su dag pa'i ye shes pa yong do zhe na /
translated: but rather the completely pure pristine consciousness is brought forth,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'grib dang phul byung phyir gnyen po //
analyzed: 'grib dang phul byung phyir gnyen po //
translated: Because of decrease and excellence, the antidote

original: dang ni rang phyogs 'phel ba na //
analyzed: dang ni rang phyogs 'phel ba na //
translated: and because of the increase of one’s own position,

original: rang gi sa bon rgyu can skyon //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon rgyu can skyon //
translated: the faults that arise from one’s own seed

analyzed: dbang bskur ba yang bzlog pa med // ces bya ba la /
translated: are not stopped by the initiation.

original: rang gi sa bon las byung ba can gyi /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon las byung ba can gyi /

analyzed: skyon rnams dbang bskur ba'i skye bo @393b la yang skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rang gi sa bon las byung ba'i skyon du ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How are the faults that arise from one’s own seed known?

analyzed: 'grib pa pa dag phul du byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of decrease and excellence.🔽When the antidote, the increase of selflessness, decreases,

analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs bdag med pa 'phel pa na 'grib pa'i phyir dang / rang gi phyogs tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'phel na /
translated: and when one’s own position, incorrect attention, increases,

original: phul du byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phul du byung ba'i phyir /
translated: there is excellence.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyon rnams dbang bskur ba la yang bkag pa med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i skyon rnams dbang bskur ba la yang bkag pa med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If such faults are not even prohibited in the context of the consecration of a statue,

analyzed: ji ltar tshe 'di nyid dang gzhan la 'di dag grol bar 'gyur /
translated: how could they be liberated in this life or another?

analyzed: gal te bdag med pa mthong ba na /
translated: If one sees selflessness,

analyzed: gang zhig grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: who would be liberated?

analyzed: skyes bu 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon gyis bcom pa gang gi tshe gang yang rung bas dag par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: When a person is destroyed by the faults of attachment and so on, would they not be purified by any means?

original: de'i tshe grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, they would be liberated.

original: 'di ltar 'ching ba zhig pa ni grol ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ching ba zhig pa ni grol ba ste /
translated: Thus, the destruction of bondage is liberation.

original: bdag med pa la ni gang zhig bcings pa nyid de de grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag med pa la ni gang zhig bcings pa nyid de de grol bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: But if there is no self, who is bound and who would be liberated?

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis gzhan grol ba thob pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis gzhan grol ba thob pa yin no zhe na /
translated: And if it is said that another obtains liberation through impermanence,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang zhig dag pa de las gzhan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa med do //
analyzed: gang zhig dag pa de las gzhan pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa med do //
translated: If one is purified, there is no nirvana other than that.

analyzed: 'o na sgron ma'i gsal ba zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn’t the term “illumination of a lamp” used?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i phyogs la tshig tu sbyar ba tsam nyid 'di 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not tenable that the Buddhist position is merely a verbal designation.

original: gang ma bcings pa de grol bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang ma bcings pa de grol bar 'gyur la /
translated: That which is not bound is liberated.

original: de yang dpes sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dpes sgrub pa yin no //
translated: And that is established by the example.

analyzed: bdag tu smra ba la ni bcing ba dang / grol ba nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: But it is not tenable that the proponent of the self is bound and liberated.

original: tshig tu sbyar ba tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ni ci yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: tshig tu sbyar ba tsam gyis bsgrubs pa ni ci yang ma yin zhing /
translated: Nothing is established by mere verbal designation.

original: gtso bo'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i dngos po mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the entity of the primary principle is untenable.

analyzed: bdag mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no example of the self passing into nirvana.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it was said:

analyzed: rtag pa ltos pa med pa'i phyir //

analyzed: rim gyis skye ba 'gal ba min // byed dang byed min dus dag tu //
translated: It is not contradictory that it arises in sequence.🔽In the past and future

original: 'dra ba yi ni bdag nyid yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dra ba yi ni bdag nyid yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is the same self, active and inactive.

analyzed: gnas skabs tha dad na ni bdag gi grol ba nyid ma dag pa'i dus su yod pa dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Here, if the self is different in each state, then the self that is liberated would not exist in the impure state.

original: rim gyis skye ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rtag pa la 'gal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba'i bde ba la sogs pa rtag pa la 'gal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: It would be contradictory for the pleasure of gradual arising, etc. to be permanent.

analyzed: ; bdag rtag pa ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i gnas skabs cig car yod par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that if the self were permanent, it would follow, absurdly, that pleasure, etc. would exist simultaneously, because the permanent self would be independent.

original: gzhan yang bya ba byed pa dang yang 'gal te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba byed pa dang yang 'gal te /
translated: Moreover, it contradicts the performance of actions.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What does?

analyzed: byed pa dang mi byed pa'i gnas skabs dag 'dra ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes @394a * //
translated: It has been demonstrated that the states of performing and not performing are similar in that they are the same self.

original: bstan to // rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid kyang //
analyzed: bstan to // rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nyid kyang //
translated: Also, cause and effect would be the same.

original: de las de dag log na ni //🔽byed pa za ba po nyams shing /
analyzed: de las de dag log na ni // byed pa za ba po nyams shing /
translated: If they were different from it,🔽then the agent would not experience the results of his actions,

analyzed: nus pa nyid ni 'grub mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the very possibility of efficacy would be lost.

original: gnas skabs dang skyes bu dag de'i bdag nyid du gyur na /

analyzed: 'joms te / sred pa zad pa de las grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is liberated from the exhaustion of craving.

original: las dang lus gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang lus gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: One is not liberated due to the destruction of karma and the body.

original: sred pa med pas ji ltar thar bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: sred pa med pas ji ltar thar bar 'gyur zhe na smras pa /
translated: If one asks, “How is one liberated due to the exhaustion of craving?”

original: las dang lus dag gnas na yang //
analyzed: las dang lus dag gnas na yang //
translated: Karma and the body remain,

original: gcig med phyir na rgyu gsum can //
analyzed: gcig med phyir na rgyu gsum can //
translated: but due to the absence of one, the three causes

original: skye ba dag ni mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: skye ba dag ni mi 'byung ste //
translated: of birth do not occur,

original: sa bon med par myu gu bzhin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sa bon med par myu gu bzhin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: like a sprout without a seed.

original: ma rig pa dang / las dang / lus kyi rgyu can gyis skye ba ni mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / las dang / lus kyi rgyu can gyis skye ba ni mi 'byung ste /
translated: Birth that has the causes of ignorance, karma, and the body does not occur.

original: las dang lus gnas na yang sred pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu gcig med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang lus gnas na yang sred pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu gcig med pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though karma and the body remain, due to the absence of the one cause called “craving,”

original: dper na sa bon med na sa la sogs pa yod kyang myu gu skye ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon med na sa la sogs pa yod kyang myu gu skye ba ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even if the earth, etc. exist, a sprout does not arise if the seed does not exist.

original: 'on te las dang lus dag las gcig 'gag sa nas thar bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te las dang lus dag las gcig 'gag sa nas thar bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: But if one of the two, karma and body, is stopped, then liberation would occur.

original: gang zhig las zad na thar par 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
analyzed: gang zhig las zad na thar par 'gyur ro zhes smras so //
translated: But it is said that liberation occurs when karma is exhausted.

original: las dang lus dag spong min te //
analyzed: las dang lus dag spong min te //
translated: Karma and the body are not abandoned

original: gnyen po phyogs ni med phyir dang // nus med phyir ro sred pa ni //
analyzed: gnyen po phyogs ni med phyir dang // nus med phyir ro sred pa ni //
translated: because there is no antidote, because they are powerless,

original: yod na yang ni 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: yod na yang ni 'byung phyir ro //
translated: and because craving would arise even if it existed.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sred pa dang bral ba ma yin pa'i gnyen po gzhan las rang lus zad par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba ma yin pa'i gnyen po gzhan las rang lus zad par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The body is not exhausted by itself through an antidote other than freedom from craving,

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i cho ga ni sun phyung zin to //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i cho ga ni sun phyung zin to //
translated: because the ritual of the senses, etc. has already been refuted.

original: de bas na las kyi gnyen po med pa'i phyir las dang lus dag spong bar byed mi nus te /
analyzed: de bas na las kyi gnyen po med pa'i phyir las dang lus dag spong bar byed mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, because there is no antidote to karma, one is not able to abandon karma and the body.

original: gnyen po yod na yang las mi shes pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po la 'dris par mi rung zhing las zad par yang mi nus pa'i phyir spong bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po yod na yang las mi shes pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po la 'dris par mi rung zhing las zad par yang mi nus pa'i phyir spong bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because one does not know the karma, even if there is an antidote, it is not possible to cultivate its antidote, and it is not possible to exhaust karma. Therefore, it is not reasonable to abandon it.

original: las byed pa ni sred pa yin te /
analyzed: las byed pa ni sred pa yin te /
translated: Craving is the agent of karma,

original: de las 'dod chags la sogs pa tshegs med pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags la sogs pa tshegs med pa nyid du 'byung ngo //
translated: because attachment and so on arise effortlessly from it.

original: des na sred pa yod na slar yang 'khor ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na sred pa yod na slar yang 'khor ba 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, if craving exists, samsara arises again.

original: 'on te las dang sred pa gnyi ga zad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te las dang sred pa gnyi ga zad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if both karma and craving are exhausted,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gnyis zad don du 'bad na yang //🔽las zad ngal ba don med 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis zad don du 'bad na yang // las zad ngal ba don med 'gyur //
translated: Even if one strives to exhaust both,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: the exhaustion of karma is pointless toil.

original: sred pa dang las gnyis zad pa'i don du 'bad na yang /
analyzed: sred pa dang las gnyis zad pa'i don du 'bad na yang /
translated: Here, even if one strives to exhaust both craving and karma,

original: las zad par bya ba'i phyir ngal pa ni don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las zad par bya ba'i phyir ngal pa ni don med par 'gyur te /
translated: the toil of exhausting karma is pointless.

original: sred pa nyid bzlog par bya ba bla'i //
analyzed: sred pa nyid bzlog par bya ba bla'i //
translated: It is better to stop craving alone.

original: las kyang dgag par bya ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: las kyang dgag par bya ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te /
translated: It is not so that karma alone should be stopped.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pas so //
translated: because it is impossible for the antidote to exist.

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir //🔽las nus sna tshogs rjes su dpog / de phyir gdung ba'i nyon mongs ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu sna tshogs mthong ba'i phyir // las nus sna tshogs rjes su dpog / de phyir gdung ba'i nyon mongs ni //
translated: Moreover, because of seeing the variety of effects,🔽the potency of karma is inferred to be various.

original: gcig gi rang bzhin zad pa min //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin zad pa min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the affliction of torment is not the exhaustion of a single nature.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa du ma can sna tshogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnam pa du ma can sna tshogs pa mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, because of seeing the variety of effects, such as pleasure, which have many aspects,

original: las la sogs pa'i nus pa sna tshogs par nges par byed do //🔽de'i phyir 'bras bu gcig gi rnam pa @396a * //
analyzed: las la sogs pa'i nus pa sna tshogs par nges par byed do // de'i phyir 'bras bu gcig gi rnam pa @396a * //
translated: the potency of karma and so on is ascertained to be various.

original: can gdung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo longs spyod pas las zad par ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: can gdung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo longs spyod pas las zad par ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the exhaustion of karma come about through the experience of torment and so on, which have the aspect of a single effect?

original: gang gi phyir /🔽rnam 'gas de bskyed 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / rnam 'gas de bskyed 'bras bu ni //
translated: Because🔽in what way does that generate it?

original: chung gyur rigs mi mthun ldan min //
analyzed: chung gyur rigs mi mthun ldan min //
translated: The effect is not small, nor is it endowed with a dissimilar type.

original: zhes bya ba la las gang zhig gis de'i rigs kyi 'bras bu bya ba de ni 'bras bu'i cha shas tsam nyams su myong ba'i phyir las de las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la las gang zhig gis de'i rigs kyi 'bras bu bya ba de ni 'bras bu'i cha shas tsam nyams su myong ba'i phyir las de las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: The action that produces the result of that type is reversed by experiencing a mere part of the result.

original: 'bras bu nyid 'bras bu nyams su myong bas zlog par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid 'bras bu nyams su myong bas zlog par byed kyi /
translated: The result itself is reversed by experiencing the result.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that a result incompatible with that is produced.

original: 'on te yang /🔽dka' thub kyi ni nus pa yis //
analyzed: 'on te yang / dka' thub kyi ni nus pa yis //
translated: But if you say:🔽By the power of austerities,

original: nus pa 'dre zhing zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nus pa 'dre zhing zad pa'i phyir //
translated: the potency is mixed and exhausted,

original: nyon mongs cha ni gang zhig gis //
analyzed: nyon mongs cha ni gang zhig gis //
translated: by what part of the affliction

original: nyon mongs ma lus spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma lus spong bar 'gyur //
translated: will all afflictions be abandoned?

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: You say:

original: dka' thub la nus pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dka' thub la nus pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Don’t austerities have power?

original: de'i las kyis nus pa rnams 'dre ba ste /
analyzed: de'i las kyis nus pa rnams 'dre ba ste /
translated: By their power, the potencies are mixed,

original: 'bras bu mtshungs par ster ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mtshungs par ster ba'o //
translated: that is, they give rise to a result that is similar.

original: zad pa ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'jig pa'o //
translated: They are exhausted, that is, they are destroyed in every way.

original: des na nyon mongs pa'i cha 'ga' zhig gis las ma lus pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na nyon mongs pa'i cha 'ga' zhig gis las ma lus pa spong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, by some part of the affliction, all karma will be abandoned.

original: de la yang smras pa /
analyzed: de la yang smras pa /
translated: To that we reply:

original: gal te nyon mongs las dka' thub //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs las dka' thub //
translated: If austerities were to arise from afflictions,🔽

original: de gzhan nyon mongs nyid yin na //
analyzed: de gzhan nyon mongs nyid yin na //
translated: If austerity were other than affliction,

original: de yi las 'bras phyir 'di las //🔽nus pa'i 'dre ba la sogs min //
analyzed: de yi las 'bras phyir 'di las // nus pa'i 'dre ba la sogs min //
translated: then it would be the cause of the result of karma.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it would not be a mixing of potencies, etc.

original: gal te yongs su gdung ba las gzhan yin na ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i cha las ma lus pa'i las spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yongs su gdung ba las gzhan yin na ni de'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i cha las ma lus pa'i las spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If austerity were other than affliction, then at that time the abandonment of karma would be complete, because of the abandonment of the part of affliction.

original: nus pa 'dres pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: nus pa 'dres pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: In the position of mixing potencies,

original: zad pa'i phyogs la ni nyon mongs pa'i med pa nyid du spong ba yin no //
analyzed: zad pa'i phyogs la ni nyon mongs pa'i med pa nyid du spong ba yin no //
translated: in the position of exhaustion, the nonexistence of affliction itself is abandoned.

original: 'on te nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dka' thub yin na /
analyzed: 'on te nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid dka' thub yin na /
translated: But if austerity is the very nature of affliction,

original: 'o na ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid can dka' thub las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dka' thub 'di las kyi nus pa ma 'dre ba ma yin pa dang / zad par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid can dka' thub las kyi 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dka' thub 'di las kyi nus pa ma 'dre ba ma yin pa dang / zad par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: then because austerity is the result of karma, which is the very nature of affliction, this austerity would not be the unmixed potency of karma, nor would it be the exhaustion of karma,

original: grang ba nyi ma bsten pa can gyi phyugs la sogs pa rnams kyang las zad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grang ba nyi ma bsten pa can gyi phyugs la sogs pa rnams kyang las zad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that the exhaustion of karma would occur for cattle, etc., who rely on the sun to relieve the cold.

original: 'on te de ni las kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de ni las kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the result of action,

original: 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced by desire.

original: las kyi 'bras bu de ni 'dod pa dang bral bar skye ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu de ni 'dod pa dang bral bar skye ba'o zhe na /
translated: The result of action is produced without desire.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: This is not true,

original: 'dod pas rgyal po thob pa la sogs pa las kyi 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pas rgyal po thob pa la sogs pa las kyi 'bras bur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the result of action is not produced by desire, as in the case of the attainment of kingship, etc.🔽But if one were to claim that one who is not attached to kingship, etc.🔽would reject them, and that one who is attached to the suffering of hell, etc.

original: 'on te rgyal po la sogs pa la zhen pa med par spong bar 'gyur la dmyal ba la sogs pa dbang med du 'bab pa'i phyir de nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on te rgyal po la sogs pa la zhen pa med par spong bar 'gyur la dmyal ba la sogs pa dbang med du 'bab pa'i phyir de nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: would not reject them, then the suffering of hell, etc.🔽would be the result of action.

original: de bas na gdung ba nyid la dka' thub tu 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na gdung ba nyid la dka' thub tu 'dod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the mere experience of suffering is not austerity.🔽If that were austerity, then the suffering of hell would be austerity.

original: de lta na ni dmyal ba'i sdug @396b bsngal yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba kho na byed pa ji ltar dka' thub kyis de zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta na ni dmyal ba'i sdug @396b bsngal yang nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba kho na byed pa ji ltar dka' thub kyis de zad par 'gyur /
translated: How could austerity destroy that?

original: 'on te dka' thub kyi sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te dka' thub kyi sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you claim that it is austerity because it is the suffering of austerity,

original: skra 'bal bal sogs pa'i dka' thub kyi sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal spong bar byed de /
analyzed: skra 'bal bal sogs pa'i dka' thub kyi sdug bsngal ba nyid kyis dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal spong bar byed de /
translated: The suffering of austerities such as pulling out one’s hair and so on is the cause for abandoning the suffering of the hells and so on.

original: skra 'bal ba ni las byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skra 'bal ba ni las byed par 'gyur ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la tshad ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition of the reason that pulling out one’s hair is the cause for abandoning karma.

original: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan bzhin no //
translated: Because it is suffering, it is like other sufferings.

original: 'on te 'di ni ma nges pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ni ma nges pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that this is not certain,

original: khyod kyis smras pa'i tshad ma de la mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyod kyis smras pa'i tshad ma de la mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: then the same applies to your valid cognition.

original: 'on te las spong bar byed pa'i don du 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir dang / khyed la yang las zad par yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la /
analyzed: 'on te las spong bar byed pa'i don du 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir dang / khyed la yang las zad par yod pa'i phyir khas blangs pa la /
translated: But if you say that it is because there is engagement for the purpose of abandoning karma, and because you also have the exhaustion of karma,

original: ji ltar gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gnod par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can you avoid the fault of accepting🔽that?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: skye 'dod skyon ni bcom pa'i phyir //
analyzed: skye 'dod skyon ni bcom pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the desire for birth is destroyed,

original: gang yang skyon ni 'gal ba can //
analyzed: gang yang skyon ni 'gal ba can //
translated: the faults that are contradictory

original: de skyes las kyis nus 'gyur gyi //
analyzed: de skyes las kyis nus 'gyur gyi //
translated: are generated, and karma becomes potent.

original: ji ltar byas pa spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar byas pa spong bar 'gyur //
translated: How can one abandon what is done?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: las ni spong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: las ni spong ba ma yin te /
translated: Action is not abandoned,

original: byas pa 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because what has been done does not perish.

original: 'o na ji ltar las zad par brjod ce na //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar las zad par brjod ce na //
translated: But how can action be exhausted?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: las de ni rgyu gzhan yod pa gang gis 'bras bu ster ba de 'dra ba la de 'gal ba can nye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: las de ni rgyu gzhan yod pa gang gis 'bras bu ster ba de 'dra ba la de 'gal ba can nye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: That action which has a cause, by which it gives a result, is not opposed by that which is similar to it.

original: gang yang gdon mi za bar 'bras bu ster nus pa de ni nges pa kho nar 'bras bu skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gang yang gdon mi za bar 'bras bu ster nus pa de ni nges pa kho nar 'bras bu skyed par byed de /
translated: And that which is able to give a result without fail, that definitely produces a result.

original: de'i don du thub pa'i skye bo 'bad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i don du thub pa'i skye bo 'bad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The wise do not strive for that,

original: de ni stobs kho nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni stobs kho nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises by its own power.

original: gang yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'gal ba can bdag med par mthong ba la sogs pa de ni de las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'gal ba can bdag med par mthong ba la sogs pa de ni de las skyes pa ste /
translated: And that which is opposed to desire, etc., such as the vision of selflessness, arises from that,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa las skyed pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i las zlog par byed nus par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa las skyed pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i las zlog par byed nus par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and is able to stop future action that is generated from faults such as desire.

original: byas zin pa ni bdag med par mthong bas kyang spong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byas zin pa ni bdag med par mthong bas kyang spong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But what has already been done is not abandoned by the vision of selflessness.

original: 'o na ji ltar byas zin pa'i nyes pa dang las ji ltar 'jig ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byas zin pa'i nyes pa dang las ji ltar 'jig ce na /
translated: How then can the faults and actions that have already been done be destroyed?

original: skyon rnams skyes par 'gyur ba la ni ldog pa med kyi /
analyzed: skyon rnams skyes par 'gyur ba la ni ldog pa med kyi /
translated: There is no way to stop the faults that have already arisen.

original: 'on kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skyon rnams las 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i skyon rnams las 'gog pa yin te /
translated: However, one stops the faults that will arise.

original: de yang rgyu zad pas mi skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rgyu zad pas mi skye ba yin no //
translated: And that is due to the exhaustion of the cause, which is non-arising.

original: de nas de yis byas pa'i las mi skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas de yis byas pa'i las mi skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, because the karma that has been done does not arise,

original: byas pa rnams spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byas pa rnams spang bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not reasonable that what has been done is abandoned.

original: lhan cig byed pa ma tshad bas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba las ni 'bras bu ster ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa ma tshad bas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba las ni 'bras bu ster ba ma yin no //
translated: Also, when the cooperating conditions are incomplete, the karma does not give its effect, even though one is free from attachment.

original: 'o na ji ltar sred pa brten par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sred pa brten par 'gyur na /
translated: How then can craving be supported?

original: las slar skye par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: las slar skye par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: If karma arises again,

original: las la brten na yang sred pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: las la brten na yang sred pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then, even though one relies on karma, craving would not arise, and one would not be liberated.

original: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not reasonable.

original: zhes smras pa /
analyzed: zhes smras pa /
translated: It was said:

original: las las skyon byung ma @397a * //
analyzed: las las skyon byung ma @397a * //
translated: The faults that arise from karma

original: yin gyi // skyon ldan byed 'gyur ldog las min //
analyzed: yin gyi // skyon ldan byed 'gyur ldog las min //
translated: But not from the one who is free from faults, nor from the one who is not engaged in action.

original: log pa'i rnam rtog med la min //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam rtog med la min //
translated: Nor from the one who is free from the false imagination.

original: bde ba las kyang 'dod ma yin /
analyzed: bde ba las kyang 'dod ma yin /
translated: Nor from the one who is attached to pleasure.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: sred pa yod na 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams las byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sred pa yod na 'bras bu don du gnyer ba rnams las byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When there is craving, those who seek results will engage in action.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon med pa las 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyon med pa las 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But not from the one who is free from faults such as attachment.

original: gang chags pa dang bral ba de ni sred pa med pas las byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang chags pa dang bral ba de ni sred pa med pas las byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For the one who is free from attachment does not engage in action because of the absence of craving.

original: 'on te dge ba'i las bde bar byed nus pa'i phyir bde ba la rjes su chags pa can gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dge ba'i las bde bar byed nus pa'i phyir bde ba la rjes su chags pa can gdon mi za bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that the one who is able to make wholesome action fruitful must certainly be attached to pleasure,

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa log pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par ni bde ba las kyang 'dod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa log pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par ni bde ba las kyang 'dod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that even from pleasure there is no desire for the one who is free from the false imagination that is the mistaken adherence to the self and what is mine?

original: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba zad pa kho nas thar bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba zad pa kho nas thar bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, liberation occurs only through the exhaustion of the view of the transitory collection.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur in any other way.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid skyob pa yin pa de'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyob pa las bde bar gshegs pa nyid nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa nyid skyob pa yin pa de'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston pa'i mtshan nyid kyi skyob pa las bde bar gshegs pa nyid nges pa yin no //
translated: Since the Teacher is the protector by teaching the four noble truths, the Sugata is ascertained as the protector who has the defining characteristic of teaching the four noble truths.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:🔽From the protector, the one who knows reality, the steadfast,🔽the one who knows without exception and without distinction,

original: skyob las de nyid dang brtan dang // ma lus khyad par mkhyen bsgrub dang // rtogs pa'i don phyir gshegs pa ste //
analyzed: skyob las de nyid dang brtan dang // ma lus khyad par mkhyen bsgrub dang // rtogs pa'i don phyir gshegs pa ste //
translated: and the one who goes for the sake of realizing the goal,

original: phyi rol slob ma'i slob lhag phyir //
analyzed: phyi rol slob ma'i slob lhag phyir //
translated: the external, the disciple, the superior, the training,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the one who has no more training.

original: skyob pa las bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyid du shes bar bya ste /
analyzed: skyob pa las bcom ldan 'das bde bar gshegs pa nyid du shes bar bya ste /
translated: From the protector, the Bhagavān should be known as the Sugata.

original: bde bar gshegs pa de yang de nyid dang / brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa ste ;
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa de yang de nyid dang / brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa ste ;
translated: And that Sugata is the one who knows reality, the steadfast, the one who knows without exception and without distinction,

original: rab tu mdzes pa mkhyen pa ni de kho na nyid mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu mdzes pa mkhyen pa ni de kho na nyid mkhyen pa'o //
translated: the one who knows the beautiful, the one who knows the real.

original: mkhyen pas slar mi ldog pa mkhyen pa ni brtan par mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: mkhyen pas slar mi ldog pa mkhyen pa ni brtan par mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The one who knows without returning through knowledge is the one who knows the steadfast.

original: brtan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa ni phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The steadfast one is the one who does not return.

original: khyad par ma lus par mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par ma lus par mkhyen pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mkhyen pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the Omniscient One is the knowledge of all aspects,

original: lhag ma ma lus par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro //🔽rtogs pa'i don gyis /
analyzed: lhag ma ma lus par mkhyen pa'i phyir ro // rtogs pa'i don gyis /
translated: because it knows all aspects without exception.

original: ga'i skad kyi dbyings las gshegs par bshad de /
analyzed: ga'i skad kyi dbyings las gshegs par bshad de /
translated: The word “gone” is explained as having the meaning of realization.

original: mkhyen pa de bcom ldan 'das la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhyen pa de bcom ldan 'das la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Blessed One is called “gone” because he has that knowledge.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa ba rgyud pas 'di shes pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa ba rgyud pas 'di shes pa yin na /
translated: If the Omniscient One is known by a succession of inferences,

original: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar mngon sum du gzigs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji ltar mngon sum du gzigs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the Blessed One be said to have directly perceived it?

original: de lta na ni gzhan dag gis kyang yongs su shes par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /🔽rjes su dpag pa ni la la yod kyi /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhan dag gis kyang yongs su shes par 'gyur ba ma yin nam / rjes su dpag pa ni la la yod kyi /
translated: If that is so, then others would also know it,🔽because inference is not always present,

original: la la med pa'i cha yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la la med pa'i cha yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but sometimes is and sometimes is not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa med na gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa med na gcig la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If the Blessed One had not taught it, it would not be known by anyone.

original: de bas na dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin no zhes shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin no zhes shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the Blessed One alone knows all things in all aspects.

original: don thams @397b cad rnam pa thams cad kyi mngon sum du bya ba ma gtogs par dngos po thams cad ma rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don thams @397b cad rnam pa thams cad kyi mngon sum du bya ba ma gtogs par dngos po thams cad ma rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Apart from the direct perception of all things in all ways, there is no such thing as “all things are impermanent,” and so on.

original: ma mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ma nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid ma nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is not seen is not ascertained.

original: 'on te bdag cag la sogs pa bstan pa las yongs su shes pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on te bdag cag la sogs pa bstan pa las yongs su shes pa de bzhin du /
translated: But if we and others know it from the teaching,

original: de'i yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: then it will arise for them too.

original: zhen / bdag cag gis kyang de yis nye bar bstan pa med na /
analyzed: zhen / bdag cag gis kyang de yis nye bar bstan pa med na /
translated: But if we do not teach it,

original: yongs su shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then knowledge will not arise for them.

original: de bas na gang mngon sum du gzags pa dang gzhan la yang ston pa gang yin pa de la ni 'di nges par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na gang mngon sum du gzags pa dang gzhan la yang ston pa gang yin pa de la ni 'di nges par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, that which is directly perceived and taught to others is ascertained for them.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: But not for others.

original: de'i phyir skyob pa las de kho na nyid dang / brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skyob pa las de kho na nyid dang / brtan pa dang / ma lus pa'i khyad par mkhyen pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of reality, stability, and the complete distinction is accomplished from the protector.

original: de kho na mkhyen pas ni phyi rol mu stegs pa las lhag par yin no //
analyzed: de kho na mkhyen pas ni phyi rol mu stegs pa las lhag par yin no //
translated: By knowing reality, he is superior to the non-Buddhist outsiders.

original: brtan par mkhyen pas ni rgyun du zhugs pa las lhag par yin no //
analyzed: brtan par mkhyen pas ni rgyun du zhugs pa las lhag par yin no //
translated: By knowing stability, he is superior to the stream-enterers.

original: khyad par ma lus par mkhyen pas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' las lhag pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par ma lus par mkhyen pas ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' las lhag pa yin te /
translated: By knowing all the distinctions, he is superior to the detached, the disciples, the solitary sages, and the bodhisattvas.

original: bde bar gshegs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the Well-Gone.

original: de'i phyir / gzhan don mkhyen sbyor brtson pa yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gzhan don mkhyen sbyor brtson pa yis //
translated: Therefore,

original: bstan pa de ni brtse ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bstan pa de ni brtse ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the teaching is compassion,

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don mkhyen par brtson pas /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don mkhyen par brtson pas /
translated: since it is applied to the knowledge of others' aims.

original: bstan bcos zhes bya ba'i ming can bstan pa rgyur dpog par byed do //
analyzed: bstan bcos zhes bya ba'i ming can bstan pa rgyur dpog par byed do //
translated: Because he is the Well-Gone, the teaching, which is named the treatise, is inferred to be the cause of the application to the knowledge of others' aims.

original: bstan pa de las kyang brtse bar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa de las kyang brtse bar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: And from that teaching, compassion is understood.

original: gzhan du na gzhan gyi don mkhyen par brtson pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan gyi don mkhyen par brtson pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be applied to the knowledge of others' aims.

original: bde bar gshegs pa nyid tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa nyid tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin nam /
translated: Is the mere state of being a Sugata not a valid cognition?

original: brtse ba ldan pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa 'di dag gis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: brtse ba ldan pa la sogs pa bsgrub pa 'di dag gis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What is the use of establishing his compassion and so on?

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /🔽de las gzhan don la ltos pa //
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te / de las gzhan don la ltos pa //
translated: That is not so.

original: grub pa'i don du ngal med phyir //
analyzed: grub pa'i don du ngal med phyir //
translated: Because he is not wearied by the accomplishment of the aims of others,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: which is dependent on something other than that.

original: ye shes tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: ye shes tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: The Blessed One is not a valid cognition by mere gnosis.

original: 'on kyang slu ba med pa'i phyir yin no /
analyzed: 'on kyang slu ba med pa'i phyir yin no /
translated: However, he is because he is nondeceptive.

original: 'on kyang slu ba med pa'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang slu ba med pa'i phyir yin no //
translated: However, he is because he is nondeceptive.

original: brtse ba de las gzhan gyi don la rag las pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das grub pas na gzhan gyi don gyi ngal ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtse ba de las gzhan gyi don la rag las pa nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das grub pas na gzhan gyi don gyi ngal ba med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the Blessed One who is accomplished through compassion, which is dependent on something other than that, he is not wearied by the aims of others.

original: brtse ba las gzhan gyi don thams cad byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: brtse ba las gzhan gyi don thams cad byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Compassion accomplishes all the aims of others,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not complete nirvana.

original: gzhan yang brtse bas legs par mdzad //
analyzed: gzhan yang brtse bas legs par mdzad //
translated: Moreover, he acts well through compassion,

original: ye shes las bden sgrub byed bcas //
analyzed: ye shes las bden sgrub byed bcas //
translated: and through gnosis, he is endowed with the accomplishment of the truth.

original: gang phyir de gsung bar mngon brtson //
analyzed: gang phyir de gsung bar mngon brtson //
translated: Because he is intent on teaching that.🔽

original: ldan pa de phyir tshad ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldan pa de phyir tshad ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because he is endowed with these four, he is authoritative.

original: brtse ba dang ldan pas legs par ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: brtse ba dang ldan pas legs par ston par mdzad la /
translated: Here, he is a teacher because he is endowed with compassion.

original: ye shes las bden pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes las bden pa ste /
translated: He is a speaker of the truth because of his knowledge.

original: yang dag par ston par @398a * //
analyzed: yang dag par ston par @398a * //
translated: He is a teacher because he teaches correctly.

original: mdzad do // ye shes dang / sgrub pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir sgrub byed bcas pa ste /
analyzed: mdzad do // ye shes dang / sgrub pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa'i phyir sgrub byed bcas pa ste /
translated: He is endowed with practice because he engages in practice along with knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir gsung bar mngon par brtson pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu bzhi yod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gsung bar mngon par brtson pa dang ldan pa'i rgyu bzhi yod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das tshad ma nyid do //
translated: Because he is endowed with these four causes of being authoritative, the Lord is authoritative.

original: 'o na nye bar bstan pa bden pas bstod pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na nye bar bstan pa bden pas bstod pa la dgos pa ci yod ce na /
translated: Now, what is the purpose of praising the Teacher with praise of the truth of his teaching?

original: smras pa / de yis bstan pa nyid la ni //🔽ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod pa //
analyzed: smras pa / de yis bstan pa nyid la ni // ston pa de lta'i dngos bstod pa //
translated: It is said:🔽The praise of the Teacher himself

original: tshang ma'i de nyid grub don du //
analyzed: tshang ma'i de nyid grub don du //
translated: is for the purpose of establishing the truth of his teaching.

original: rjes su dpag pa'ang zlog med phyir //🔽cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'ang zlog med phyir // cung zad skye ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: Because it is impossible to refute his inference,🔽and because everything that has the nature of arising

original: gang de thams cad 'gog chos can //
analyzed: gang de thams cad 'gog chos can //
translated: is necessarily subject to cessation.

original: zhes sogs rnam pa du mar yang //🔽'di yi sbyor ba mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes sogs rnam pa du mar yang // 'di yi sbyor ba mthong phyir ro //
translated: and so on, in many ways.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because the application of this is seen.

original: nye bar bstan pa de lta bu'i dngos po tshad ma'i mtshan nyid can gyi bstod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa las ni tshad ma nyid grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa de lta bu'i dngos po tshad ma'i mtshan nyid can gyi bstod pa bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa las ni tshad ma nyid grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this passage, the praise of the Blessed One, which is the entity that is taught in this way, has the characteristic of a valid cognition.🔽From the teaching of the Blessed One, valid cognition is established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa mngon sum nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar bstan pa mngon sum nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the teaching of the Blessed One direct perception?

original: sngon po'i shes pa can gyi skyes bus sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o zhes ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po'i shes pa can gyi skyes bus sngon po shes kyi sngon po'o zhes ni ma yin no zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: A person who has a cognition of blue knows blue, but not that it is blue.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang bzlog pa med pa ste ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang bzlog pa med pa ste ;
translated: Inference is also not refuted.

original: de phyir mngon par bzhed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de phyir mngon par bzhed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is indeed accepted.

original: sgra la sogs pa ni bzlog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa ni bzlog pa nyid yin te /
translated: Sound and so on are refuted.

original: gzhan gyis brtags pa thams cad ni stong pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtags pa thams cad ni stong pa yin gyi /
translated: All that is imagined by others is empty.

original: nga nyid gcig pu de kho na nyid gsungs pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga nyid gcig pu de kho na nyid gsungs pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I alone teach reality.

original: yang na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba gang cung zad skye ba'i chos can de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can zhes bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba gang cung zad skye ba'i chos can de thams cad ni 'gog pa'i chos can zhes bya ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, because of seeing that whatever is a subject that is produced is a subject that is stopped, whatever is a subject that is produced is a subject that is stopped.

original: de smras pa /🔽med na mi 'byung mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: de smras pa / med na mi 'byung mtshan nyid can //
translated: He says:

original: rtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no //
analyzed: rtags ni rjes dpag rten yin no //
translated: The reason is the basis of inference,🔽which has the characteristic of being invariably concomitant.

original: bsgrub byas gtan tshigs khyab par ni //
analyzed: bsgrub byas gtan tshigs khyab par ni //
translated: Because it teaches the pervasion of the reason by the probandum,

original: bstan phyir de yang gsal bar bshad //
analyzed: bstan phyir de yang gsal bar bshad //
translated: that is also clearly explained.

original: ces bya ba la rjes su dpag pa la brten pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba dang ldan pa ste khyab pa du mar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba la rjes su dpag pa la brten pa'i gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni med na mi 'byung ba dang ldan pa ste khyab pa du mar bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The definition of a reason that is based on inference is that it has the characteristic of being invariably concomitant. Because the pervasion has been taught many times by the Transcendent Lord,

original: gtan tshigs de rtags dang / bsgrub bya lhan cig med na mi 'byung ba gsal bar bshad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs de rtags dang / bsgrub bya lhan cig med na mi 'byung ba gsal bar bshad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that reason is clearly explained to be the evidence that is invariably concomitant with the probandum.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na tshad ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa kho na tshad ma nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, only what is taught by the Transcendent Lord is valid cognition.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi rigs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mi rigs par 'gyur /
translated: Since the Bhagavat is valid cognition itself, how could it be invalid?

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis yon tan gyi mchog tshad ma yin par dang por bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis yon tan gyi mchog tshad ma yin par dang por bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat first taught the valid cognition of the highest quality.

original: bla ma dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rab 'byung gnas kyi zhabs la btud de bsten nas nyi ma sbas pas sbyar ba tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: bla ma dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rab 'byung gnas kyi zhabs la btud de bsten nas nyi ma sbas pas sbyar ba tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
translated: Having bowed to the feet of the guru and the spiritual friend Pravachanasri and having relied upon him, this commentary on the Pramanavarttika was composed by Srisimha.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter, on the definition of valid cognition, from the commentary on the Pramanavarttika.
